Consider the following case:

Map<String, Class<? extends Serializable>> re=
sult =3D null;

assertThat(result, hasEntry("Key", java.util.Date.class));
=

This will not compile, but if the method signature of assertThat was chang=
ed to:

public static <T> void assertThat(T actual, Matcher<? extends T> ma=
tcher)

It would compile.

I would seem that it would be an appropriate cha=
nge for such cases (unless there is something I don't understand about the =
deep implications of Generics).

What do you think?

Yishai
